body.p: Hebrew a play on the name Uri
Monday, 23 of Tammuz(August), 1862.

To him who says, “My light, my salvation, whom shall I fear” That is my
friend and the friend of God, the great sage, who fears the words of God
etc., Lippman, the son of Yitzchok Issac Leeser:

Constantly interrupted, I am still unable to come there in
order to deliver personally to you my manuscript which has grown to con-
siderable proportions. Worries on every hand bring me low. “Tradition re-
quires prayer”.

I have not yet read Kayserling's work*. I don't want to
make even weaker poorer my opinion of the socalled philosopher, reformer, etc.,
Mendelssohn who certainly accomplished much- an opinion which was rather
weak poor from my youth on. Do you know the parable which the Gaon Ezekiel
Landau*, may his memory be for a blessing, spoke? What is the difference
between the learning of the wicked Balaam and the learning of our father
Abraham? Balaam, the heathen prophet, certainly showed himself as a
prince in his actions, in order to seem like Abraham, but, in the pupils
—v- so Friedlander*, one of his own children, etc., In them the differ-
ence shows itself. A hint to the wise is sufficient.

Among us be it said, Frankel's biography, by my brother-in-
law*, is a fault to be forgiven. For, as my physician writes to me, he
is a victim of the quarrel with Hirsch conducted by Frankel. My brother-
in-law was not the man for this. That is why Rappoport* does not mention
him in his weak”words of peace and truth”. He died with this work in
his hands. I am afraid that Frankel's biography which, as I hear, con-
tains much that isn't so, realizes the statement “Through the praise
given a man.one can recognize his faults”. Landau was more just in his
funeral oration, in which he mentions me to.....and deplores my depar-
ture. I am the Marim*. The funeral oration is beautiful and you have
probably read it.

I sent you today through Adam's express, free, the treatise
“Yebamoth” and the treatise “Kidushin”, for which I ask you to credit me

with $5. The “Tosefta*” is very much worth while from an historical
point of view, especially the one printed here from the manuscript in
Vienna. It is supposed to contain all the historical references. It
sheds much light upon the charlatan teachings of Christianity and
its lying apostles. That they wrapped themselves in the mantle of
Essenism*, I clearly indicate.

I beg of you to deliver one package with the enclosed letter
to the Chazan Pappe. You will please me by sending at once per express,
4 of your bound prayer books, but at a cheap price. The second part is
now much too expensive. For me you must make it cheaper.

Have you read my article in the “Messenger” about the
“Shochetim” ? It is....somewhat moderate, but in New York everything
is spoiled. On the one side reform, on the other side those who hate
Jewish knowledge, who play at orthodoxy in order to make a living, and
on the third side, the five Houses of Trampling- I put an s instead of
an sh*. This much I accomplished; Raphall does not lend his support any
more, and Rabbi Menachem Goldsmith, he who forgot to study, not that he
forgot his studies, will no longer examine the shochetim.

I have spoken to the old Halpern. My articles pleased him
very much. Please lend me the volumes of the Jeshurun un which he spoke
against Graetz's History, since I, too, want to come out against it.

Illoway's reports from New Orleans are to be put aside with
contempt, so a man from New Orleans told me. Hoping to hear news from
you very soon, I sign.
Respectfully,
Your friend forever
